intro: Quercus salicina f. latifolia, commonly known as the broadleaf Chinese chestnut, is a variant of the Chinese chestnut tree. It is characterized by its broad, ovate leaves that are typically 5–10 cm in length. The plant is native to eastern Asia, particularly China, and thrives in temperate climates. It produces small, edible nuts enclosed in spiny husks, which are often used in traditional medicine. The botanical features of this plant make it an important species in both ecological and horticultural contexts.
